headline: Ask HN: Once a Week Social Media?
description:
I just finished the book 'Stolen Focus' (link below), and one thing that caught my attention other than of course the algorithms working to keep us constantly looking, I was wondering if there would ever be an incentive to create a social media site that only allows it to use it once a week.

One of the things the book asserts is that individual control isn't sufficient, and it is the system which is the problem.

Would a social media site ever be successful where you can post, etc, but the site would aggregate the content and you can only view everyone else's content only once a week? It would help solve some issues like infinite scroll.

https://www.amazon.com/Stolen-Focus-Attention-Think-Deeply/dp/B09FYHKYFJ/
headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: 一周一次的社交媒体？
headline_zh-Hant: Ask HN: 一週一次的社交媒體？
description_zh-Hans:
我刚刚读完《偷来的焦点》这本书（下面有链接），有一件事引起了我的注意，当然，除了算法在努力让我们不断寻找之外，我在想，如果创建一个社交媒体网站，每周只允许它使用一次，是否会有激励作用？

书中主张的一点是，个人控制是不够的，系统才是问题所在。

一个社交媒体网站会不会成功，你可以发帖等，但网站会汇总内容，你每周只能查看别人的内容一次？ 这将有助于解决一些问题，如无限滚动。

https://www.amazon.com/Stolen-Focus-Attention-Think-Deeply/dp/B09FYHKYFJ/
